channel.title: ~Port Fowarding~ For aLL The Questions** W/ pics
channel.description:
How do I [b]Port Forward[/b] My McAfee Firewall? For My Server (I'm Making [b]My Server[/b]) [img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee208/sea-crest/HELPHELP.jpg[/img]
[ul][li]Yes I'm Asking for Help[/li] [li]Yes I will Appreciate it[/li][/ul] [br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 02, 2008, 10:41:35 AM[/size][hr][b]Up+Date*[/b]
All I Need to Know is[b]:[/b]
[ul][li]Inbound [b]TCP/IP[/b] ports[b]:[/b][/li] [li]Outbound [b]TCP/IP[/b] ports[b]:[/b][/li] [li]Inbound [b]UDP[/b] ports[b]:[/b][/li] [li]Outbound [b]UDP[/b] ports[b]:[/b][/li][/ul]
[img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee208/sea-crest/lookdude.jpg[/img] [img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee208/sea-crest/untitled.jpg[/img]
[size=30pt]IS THIS RIGHT??[/size]
[img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee208/sea-crest/imagedonefirst.jpg[/img] [img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee208/sea-crest/imageDonesecond.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee208/sea-crest/done.jpg[/img]

item.dc:creator: @fr3sh_aka_clutch fr3sh_aka_clutch
item.description:
@fr3sh_aka_clutch wrote:

SOMEONE SAID TO LEAVE IT BLANK not shir tho[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 02, 2008, 12:13:28 PM[/size][hr][quote=“n0va k0, post:3, topic:185777”]Mr dime, it’s because idiots don’t check their ipconfig/all. If there isn’t 2 dsn servers then you can’t portforward. Simple as that. Yet I’ve never seen that kind of opening port firewall. Put as name as RSPS or whatever you want, name of your server etc. Put as ports on both TCP’s 43594. Keep the UDP’s blank. No idea about the category. Hope I helped…[/quote] he said to leave it blank…

Read full topic

item.title: ~Port Fowarding~ For aLL The Questions** W/ pics
item.dc:creator: @n0va_k0 n0va k0
item.description:
@n0va_k0 wrote:

Mr dime, it’s because idiots don’t check their ipconfig/all. If there isn’t 2 dsn servers then you can’t portforward. Simple as that. Yet I’ve never seen that kind of opening port firewall. Put as name as RSPS or whatever you want, name of your server etc. Put as ports on both TCP’s 43594. Keep the UDP’s blank. No idea about the category. Hope I helped…

Read full topic
